documents.document: Regardless of how you feel about protests, the whole Soros paid protester conspiracy theory is by far the dumbest thing I have seen in 2017

This is why you don't hack hackers https://t.co/o4d9tSF2CV
@thomaskivett what was it that @KellyannePolls said about this yesterday? https://t.co/A4c8hEylF9
@thomaskivett https://t.co/3yspuOlS6l the author is a former British intel officer
@thomaskivett nothing illegal happened, it looks great for Trump Admin
@thomaskivett the point is Trump's murky financial history coupled with the report deserves a full inquiry
@thomaskivett How could anyone possibly know whether he has any Russian connections or investments without looking at his records?
@thomaskivett "Russia has never tried to use leverage over me. I HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH RUSSIA - NO DEALS, NO LOANS, NO NOTHING!"
@thomaskivett https://t.co/3g0HIWViji Aside from Trump's documented financial ties to Russia, ic handling of matter should be investigated
@thomaskivett it's obvious that the report is raw op-ed research, but hard to believe that the author outright lied to construct it
@thomaskivett Would you not agree an open inquiry would be better? Congressional inquiry could force intel chiefs to testify
@thomaskivett yeah this has sufficiently killed half my day lol
@thomaskivett just because they haven't made findings public doesn't mean there isn't anything there, only time will tell how it plays out
@thomaskivett Comey refusing to comment on whether an ongoing investigation exists does not help settle controversy (2)
@thomaskivett this either fizzles out or escalates depending on the leaks though, an official statement from FBI settles speculation (1)
@thomaskivett as I said, if there is nothing there, the ic should make it very clear that the investigation has ended to settle speculation
@thomaskivett "the IC has not made any judgement that the information in this document is reliable"
@thomaskivett if there isn't anything there, that's great! But to regain legitimacy of this admin, there needs to be more clarification
@thomaskivett until ic states all allegations are false and the investigation has ended, there are more questions than answers
@thomaskivett But Russia is now oligarchy and a failing economy, all Putin does is look to cement hold on power (3)
@thomaskivett By overtaking ex-Soviet territory, he is looking to rebuild the Eastern bloc Soviet era territorial wall against the West (2)
@thomaskivett Putin views NATO as existential threat and seeks to undermine it across the West through support of far-right parties (1)
@thomaskivett https://t.co/9NXf3IeFtJ last year Carter Page met with Igor Sechin, who has billions held up by sanctions
@thomaskivett no this https://t.co/gcswzc1u33
@thomaskivett Yes, and I don't for a minute believe it's all true, but this coupled with Trump softness on Russia sanctions is alarming
@thomaskivett "American officials further added that they believed Russia President Vladimir Putin had “leverages of pressure” over Trump"
@thomaskivett what about Israeli news story about American intelligence telling Israelis not to share info with Trump admin?
@thomaskivett no one in the ic would ever go on record about an ongoing investigation
@thomaskivett explain CIA FISA warrant request then
@thomaskivett explain how it's falling apart?
